Hi all, i've been trying to make mk3 space planes since a while ago, and i'm having bad luck since i can't build any desing capable o getting into a low/mediium orbit with a full large cargo bay, also, neither of my crafts are capable of lifting of from the runway (Mk1 and mk2 do pretty fine) so i wanted to see some desings to learn a bit more about the physics of an mk3 ssto/ cheap craft.

Thanks for your help
Go have a look at Rune's Slightly Used Vehicles, he seems to be the master of SSTO's on this forum. He's got a design capable of lifting a whole orange tank to LKO.
OK, i will have a look, thanks

Hi, I have a couple of designs fitting in this topic. You may have a look at that too.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/130452-Butler-series-SSTOs-updated-14-08-new-75t-payload-Mk3-size-craft?highlight=butler
Thanks, but it seems quite old, aren't those crafts obsolete?
Heres a simple one of mine, a full orange tank to orbit OrbitMaster

This was one of my first SSTO's,it could carry very little to LKO so it was mainly used to "ferry" kerbals from the KSP to my space station.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129386-How-to-safely-enter-the-atmosphere-and-land-my-SSTO-SP

Thanks, but it seems quite old, aren't those crafts obsolete?

I keep it updated the best I can! If I were to suggest something, I would tell you to start with the Spatha, which is very simple to use and has ample margins and a decent payload:

But if you are feeling a bit more up to the challenge, I have actually just updated the Longsword file:

A few tiny changes in order for any two of my base modules to fit in there, and I will point out that some versions got 33% payload fractions. With the given payload, it's more like 25% and some margin.

Rune. Grab either of them in my page! (link in my sig).
